title: Windows 10 High Contrast (green on black) theme clashes with default mRemoteNG theme, for connection tabs
author: BloodyIron
body_snippet:
This is regarding v1.75.7012.16814

I'm running mRemoteNG on Windows 10, and my WIndows 10 is setup to use "High Contrast #2", which is green on black, and it tries to apply that on every application possible, and in this case that includes mRemoteNG.

The problem, is that all tabs (except the selected one) are black, on black, on black, unless I mouse over a tab, or select it.

Not only that, I'm not seeing a parameter in the Theme section of mRemoteNG to change the colouring for the tab ...

iterations.description: Accessibility issue where High Contrast system settings are overridden by the application's default styling, making UI elements unreadable.

comments.author: BloodyIron
comments.snippet: So um, any chance we could get theme control for the tabs please? Black on Black is hard to read.

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet: @BloodyIron There are a few themes available out of the box in 1.76 and further enhancements to this in 1.77. Also, you can create a custom theme. Does this resolve your problem?

comments.author: BloodyIron
comments.snippet: Well I'm not talking about themeing in general, I'm talking about themeing for tabs. Last I checked, it didn't work well.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Accessibility issue where High Contrast system settings are overridden by the application's default styling, making UI elements unreadable.
Approach: Detect `SystemInformation.HighContrast` on startup and `UserPreferenceChanged`. If active, override the default DockPanel theme (likely VS2015) with a system-compatible theme (e.g., VS2005 or native) that respects OS color settings.
